025package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
026
027import javax.tools.JavaFileManager;
028import javax.tools.StandardJavaFileManager;
029import java.io.PrintWriter;
030import java.util.Objects;
031
032import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
033
034/**
035 * Provides external entry points (tool and programmatic) for the javadoc program.
036 */
037public class Main {
038
039    /**
040     * The main entry point called by the launcher. This will call
041     * System.exit with an appropriate return value.
042     *
043     * @param args the command-line parameters
044     */
045    public static void main(String... args) {
046        System.exit(execute(args));
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Programmatic interface.
051     *
052     * @param args the command-line parameters
053     * @return The return code.
054     */
055    public static int execute(String... args) {
056        Start jdoc = new Start();
057        return jdoc.begin(args).exitCode;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Programmatic interface.
062     *
063     * @param writer a stream for all output
064     * @param args the command-line parameters
065     * @return The return code.
066     */
067    public static int execute(String[] args, PrintWriter writer) {
068        Start jdoc = new Start(writer, writer);
069        return jdoc.begin(args).exitCode;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Programmatic interface.
074     *
075     * @param outWriter a stream for expected output
076     * @param errWriter a stream for diagnostic output
077     * @param args the command-line parameters
078     * @return The return code.
079     */
080    public static int execute(String[] args, PrintWriter outWriter,
081            PrintWriter errWriter) {
082        Start jdoc = new Start(outWriter, errWriter);
083        return jdoc.begin(args).exitCode;
084    }
085
086    // builder-style API to run javadoc
087
088    private PrintWriter outWriter;
089    private PrintWriter errWriter;
090    private StandardJavaFileManager fileManager;
091
092    /**
093     * Creates a default builder to run javadoc.
094     */
095    public Main() {
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Sets the output and error streams to be used when running javadoc.
100     * The streams may be the same; they must not be {@code null}.
101     *
102     * @param outWriter the output stream
103     * @param errWriter the error stream
104     *
105     * @return this object
106     */
107    public Main setStreams(PrintWriter outWriter, PrintWriter errWriter) {
108        this.outWriter = Objects.requireNonNull(outWriter);
109        this.errWriter = Objects.requireNonNull(errWriter);
110        return this;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Sets the file manager to be used when running javadoc.
115     * A value of {@code null} means to use the default file manager.
116     *
117     * @param fileManager the file manager to use
118     *
119     * @return this object
120     */
121    public Main setFileManager(StandardJavaFileManager fileManager) {
122        this.fileManager = fileManager;
123        return this;
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Runs javadoc with preconfigured values and a given set of arguments.
128     * Any errors will be reported to the error stream, or to {@link System#err}
129     * if no error stream has been specified with {@code setStreams}.
130     *
131     * @param args the arguments
132     *
133     * @return a value indicating the success or otherwise of the run
134     */
135    public Result run(String... args) {
136        Context context = null;
137        if (fileManager != null) {
138            context = new Context();
139            context.put(JavaFileManager.class, fileManager);
140        }
141        Start jdoc = new Start(context, null, outWriter, errWriter, null, null);
142        return jdoc.begin(args);
143    }
144
145    public enum Result {
146        /** completed with no errors */
147        OK(0),
148        /** Completed with reported errors */
149        ERROR(1),
150        /** Bad command-line arguments */
151        CMDERR(2),
152        /** System error or resource exhaustion */
153        SYSERR(3),
154        /** Terminated abnormally */
155        ABNORMAL(4);
156
157        Result(int exitCode) {
158            this.exitCode = exitCode;
159        }
160
161        public boolean isOK() {
162            return (exitCode == 0);
163        }
164
165        public final int exitCode;
166
167        @Override
168        public String toString() {
169            return name() + '(' + exitCode + ')';
170        }
171    }
172}
